page.title: 12KNITTING ON WHALSAY
page.content: Shetland is famous for its Fair Isle knitting,not only Fair Isle but other parts as well,including Whalsay. There is a knitwear factory on Whalsay where 3 women knit jumpers with Fair Isle patterns.They use machines more than they hand knit.It takes 4 hrs to machine knit a jumper, about 25-30 hrs to hand knit one. They use Shetland yarn that comes from Shetland sheep.Once washed jumpers have to be stretched on a board made of wood shaped like a jumper,if you don't do this they will shrink.Fair Isle patternedjumpers are made with pattern all over or just at the yoke.Prices (June 1985) for an adult size Fair Isle jumper are :hand knitted Â£30-40,machine knitted Â£25. Many people knit at home selling to knitwear shops in Lerwick.
